entry.title: Big Fuss
entry.content:
With React Native and Spring Boot, I wrote a party trivia app that will display user submitted questions.

Big Fuss was originally published by Chuyun Shen at Chuyun Shen on May 30, 2020.

entry.title: Poet
entry.content:
Poet is a lightweight Chrome extension that displays a new poem every day upon new tab launches.

Motivation: I caught myself never reading enough (to be pefectly honest, zero these days). I feel a little stuck in this hustle-bustle. I hope this brings you some solace and, more importantly, literacy…

Download Poet from the Chrome extension web store.

Displays a new poem every day.


Add poems to your favourites.


View and manage your saved poems.


Refresh for a new poem.

Check out the source code on my GitHub.

Poet was originally published by Chuyun Shen at Chuyun Shen on May 20, 2020.

entry.title: Introducing Genie
entry.content:
After careful deliberation and thorough testing with our Facebook bots under my Startbucks alter ego Emma and Natalia’s Russian mascot Boris Petrov, Genie was released. Genie, built on Python, sends your pre-drafted heartfelt birthday wishes to your Facebook friends.

[Insert gif here.]

Genie scrapes Facebook’s birthday calendar information. For Facebook friends who have not disclosed their birthday information on Facebook, users are also able to manually enter a birthday. Currently, the program requires users to log in every day to ensure the messages are sent. The logic is if the date matches a scheduled birthday, saved messages will be sent. However, in our next steps, we will be removing this barrier by taking it online.

We are actively designing a web application for Genie, making the user experience more sleek. We are going cross-platform: soon enough, you won’t be limited to only Facebook. Users will be able to schedule birthday wishes that can be sent through text messages. We are also integrating holiday calendars—you will never miss to wish your mother in law a happy thanksgiving ever again.

See the full code here.

Introducing Genie was originally published by Chuyun Shen at Chuyun Shen on January 01, 2020.

entry.title: Recruitment System
entry.content:
Recruitment system was done as part of the software design course at school. The requirements were given to us resembling how projects are handled in the industry. I got to practice design patterns, Java, and team work with this project that I worked on almost every day for two months.

Source code can be found on my GitHub.

Below are a few UML digrams illustrasting the design for our system.

Compositional Relationships

User Inheritence

Applicant Actions

Manager Inheritence

Base, Interviewer, Referee, and User Actions

Coordinator Actions

Background Actions

Documents and Storage

Tools

Recruitment System was originally published by Chuyun Shen at Chuyun Shen on August 20, 2019.
